p: In summary, while there are good reasons to think that the survival and development of Ixodes ticks may be limited by temperature and humidity ( figure 2), these limitations may only manifest at the extremes of their ranges and where ticks are not able behaviourally to avoid inhospitable conditions. Within regions that have more permissive conditions, the direct effects of temperature and humidity may be more subtle or even relatively unimportant compared, for instance, with the abundance of hosts (e.g. [ 71]).
